course_description: Following completion of at least 15 credit hours, students will determine an integrative paper topic and enroll in MRPL 620, MRPL Integrative Paper Part A for 1 hour of credit. Part A allows the student to begin shaping the initial bibliography and outline for the project. Following successful completion of MRPL 620, students enroll in MRPL 650 for 2 hours of credit in order to finish the 25-35 page integrative paper. A grade of IP will be awarded for MRPL 620 until MRPL 650 has been completed, at which time a final grade will be awarded for both MRPL 620 and MRPL 650. A final letter grade of B or higher is required to pass the course.
